{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3462248,"name":"Dale Yocum","username":"Dale","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dale/{size}/1401_2.png","created_at":"2024-12-21T16:55:52.848Z","cooked":"

Rev Robotics just started taking orders for their fancy laser-cuttable composite sheets, MaxComposite. I’ve ordered some to experiment with but I’d love to hear what others discover. What settings did you find work best on your laser cutter of X power? How well does it stand up to impacts? How flexible? Can you think of this as super strong polycarbonate or weaker (and lighter) aluminum or something else entirely?

It looks like while you can cut this with typical saws to get it down to the size of your laser cutter bed it really wants to have its edges sealed by the laser for any part you are going to use. Your experience?

REV Robotics

MAXComposite Sheets

REV Robotics designs, builds and manufactures robotics parts and components used by students for learning about science, technology, engineering, and math (STEM). Our parts are commonly used within the FIRST Robotics Competition and the FIRST Tech...

Price: USD 150

Thanks Greg. Rather than teams blowing through lots of expensive material it would be most helpful to starting places for different power lasers for the two thicknesses. We’ll still need to tweak those in our shops, of course. Thanks for making this available!

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":48,"updated_at":"2024-12-21T18:45:24.516Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":769,"readers_count":768,"score":203.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":477167,"topic_slug":"maxcomposite-experiences-and-tips","display_username":"Dale Yocum","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":511,"username":"Greg_Needel","name":"REV Robotics Co-founder & CEO","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/greg_needel/{size}/244586_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4423,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6665 C-Otters/1540 Flaming Chickens"},"post_url":"/t/maxcomposite-experiences-and-tips/477167/4","custom_user_title":"6665 C-Otters/1540 Flaming Chickens","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3466848,"name":"McKenzie Dillman","username":"mdillman","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/cc9497/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-02T18:11:49.339Z","cooked":"

We received one sheet of each thickness a few days ago and I just got to try some out. Here’s my first pass:

It cut easily on the band saw, but this should definitely be for roughing down to size as the fiber layers were frayed from cutting.

IMG_69751920×1440 188 KB

IMG_69761920×1440 118 KB

I started trying some small, simple cuts on the laser. We have a 60W Epilog Fusion CO2 laser. I could do some fine-tuning with the focus but it has been pretty well calibrated for our acrylic and plywood parts.

I ran through some material presets to see how any of them did with this material. I have only tested the thinner .1" material so far. I had the best success with the presets for 1/4" acrylic which were (8) speed, (100) power, (100) frequency.

Compared with the materials I’m used to laser cutting, I thought the edge was far from crisp and the kerf from the beam was very wide. Its a melty material. I didn’t like the goopy edges so I tried to clean it up using faster speeds, lower power, and multiple passes, but wasn’t able to get a better result than with the 1/4" acrylic presets.

IMG_69771920×1440 121 KB

IMG_69781920×1440 156 KB

IMG_69811920×1440 346 KB

I was also a little surprised to see how thin the fiber-reinforced layers outside of the core were. This sheet is almost all solid PP core with a very thin veneer layer on each side. We plan to do some torture testing compared with Lexan and aluminum to see how it compares. I did try cutting a braced 90 gusset using the same test settings listed above and it cut out easily. The goopy top edge is something I’ll need to get used to or find a cure for. I can see this replacing some of our sheet/plate parts made on the CNC router, but I don’t see the surface finish or tolerance coming close to the equivalent machined parts.

IMG_69791920×2560 297 KB

IMG_69801920×2560 259 KB

I hope this helps somebody. I’m looking forward to testing further and figuring out what others find.

@Greg_Needel I know you folks have been a tad busy but any insights on proper settings for getting the most out of MaxComposite and minimizing melting?

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":48,"updated_at":"2025-01-15T22:24:05.139Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":585,"readers_count":584,"score":172.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":477167,"topic_slug":"maxcomposite-experiences-and-tips","display_username":"Dale Yocum","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4423,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6665 C-Otters/1540 Flaming Chickens"},"post_url":"/t/maxcomposite-experiences-and-tips/477167/8","custom_user_title":"6665 C-Otters/1540 Flaming Chickens","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3483930,"name":"MT","username":"Frugez","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/frugez/{size}/269193_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-15T23:22:30.606Z","cooked":"

Not REV, but I recommend running a material power/speed test.

See video: https://youtu.be/pTx0RG_4Wbs?si=cpS-fQ-7XQUm5nwg

Find the square that looks to be the cleanest and then lower your speed by about 10% to ensure the material cuts through everywhere.

Also it looks like you could use some more air assist to help reduce the amount of material melting.

Hope this helps!

For reference:

  • CO2 65W (Boss Laser)
  • Speed 5mm/sec
  • Power 82%

PXL_20250130_2313016692075×1468 316 KB

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":48,"updated_at":"2025-01-31T00:57:50.109Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":533,"readers_count":532,"score":221.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":477167,"topic_slug":"maxcomposite-experiences-and-tips","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":5}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Director of Robotics @ WPI, Scholarship App Reviewer, Been at this too long"},"post_url":"/t/maxcomposite-experiences-and-tips/477167/11","custom_user_title":"Director of Robotics @ WPI, Scholarship App Reviewer, Been at this too long","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":5}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":5,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3497636,"name":"Dale Yocum","username":"Dale","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dale/{size}/1401_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-31T06:17:45.786Z","cooked":"

Excellent! Nice looking cut.

How many passes?
What thickness is that panel?

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":48,"updated_at":"2025-01-31T06:17:45.786Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":511,"readers_count":510,"score":112.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":477167,"topic_slug":"maxcomposite-experiences-and-tips","display_username":"Dale Yocum","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":63,"username":"ColleenShaver","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/colleenshaver/{size}/67277_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4423,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6665 C-Otters/1540 Flaming Chickens"},"post_url":"/t/maxcomposite-experiences-and-tips/477167/12","custom_user_title":"6665 C-Otters/1540 Flaming Chickens","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3498244,"name":"","username":"ColleenShaver","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/colleenshaver/{size}/67277_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-31T20:36:21.420Z","cooked":"

Single pass on the .1mm

Gets really smoky while cutting, so definitely make sure you have good filtration.

We also had the air assist going strong. Ours is currently hooked up to a regular off-board compressor and I had the output set at 20-25psi.

REVs info recommends making your settings to do it in a single pass. We had to slow it down a little from what we do for acrylic with similar power. I think two passes would likely cause too much melting away, leaving a lot of remelt to sand off and probably overall effecting the dimensions around the cuts.

","post_number":15,"post_type":1,"posts_count":48,"updated_at":"2025-01-31T21:25:45.279Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":14,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":474,"readers_count":473,"score":109.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":477167,"topic_slug":"maxcomposite-experiences-and-tips","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":4423,"username":"Dale","name":"Dale Yocum","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dale/{size}/1401_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Director of Robotics @ WPI, Scholarship App Reviewer, Been at this too long"},"post_url":"/t/maxcomposite-experiences-and-tips/477167/15","custom_user_title":"Director of Robotics @ WPI, Scholarship App Reviewer, Been at this too long","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3499209,"name":"Dale Yocum","username":"Dale","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dale/{size}/1401_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-01T20:04:25.402Z","cooked":"

Building on what @ColleenShaver at WPI found with the .1” I finally got a chance to try it on .2”. On our 100w Omtech laser the settings below worked good enough for our robot’s intake. Had to mess around with the bearing holes as the material melts enough that what was, for us, a 1.157 hole in plywood for a bearing to snug fit became a 1.11 hole in MaxComposite. Not a big deal but something to know.

Yes it does make a lot of smoke but it’s not as toxic as one might expect.

1 pass
100% power
3mm/sec

IMG_09973024×4032 2.9 MB

IMG_09983024×4032 1.8 MB

IMG_09994032×3024 3.1 MB

","post_number":17,"post_type":1,"posts_count":48,"updated_at":"2025-02-01T20:04:25.402Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":6,"reads":486,"readers_count":485,"score":187.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":477167,"topic_slug":"maxcomposite-experiences-and-tips","display_username":"Dale Yocum","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4423,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6665 C-Otters/1540 Flaming Chickens"},"post_url":"/t/maxcomposite-experiences-and-tips/477167/17","custom_user_title":"6665 C-Otters/1540 Flaming Chickens","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3499249,"name":"Dale Yocum","username":"Dale","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dale/{size}/1401_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-01T20:34:40.201Z","cooked":"

Oh, and just to reinforce what others have said, this material really wants to be laser cut to seal the edges. Sawing is fine to get it down to size for the laser cutter but it leaves a fraying edge. I wouldn’t hand drill it unless really necessary.

","post_number":18,"post_type":1,"posts_count":48,"updated_at":"2025-02-01T20:34:40.201Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":469,"readers_count":468,"score":138.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":477167,"topic_slug":"maxcomposite-experiences-and-tips","display_username":"Dale Yocum","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4423,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6665 C-Otters/1540 Flaming Chickens"},"post_url":"/t/maxcomposite-experiences-and-tips/477167/18","custom_user_title":"6665 C-Otters/1540 Flaming Chickens","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3499274,"name":"Drew B.","username":"Drew_B","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/drew_b/{size}/194417_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-01T21:01:34.793Z","cooked":"

I spent a lot of this week tuning our MaxComposite settings and wanted to add to the discussion. Starting with our settings:

This is the laser we have: Laguna SmartShop Laser EX-C 150W

0.2in. Material:
80% Power on 150W Tube
30mm/s
5 passes
50PSI air assist

0.1in Material:
80% Power on 150W Tube
30mm/s
3 passes
50PSI air assist

With these settings, everything we cut was within .005" of what we modeled it as. It was accurate enough that we were able to use laser-joint tab and slot construction without modifying any geometry. It also produced a top surface that could be scratched smooth with a dull tool, and the remaining edge on the bottom was able to be sanded off with some fine-grit sandpaper.

0.1in material top surface finish:

IMG_42371920×2560 265 KB

0.1in material bottom surface finish:

IMG_42381920×2560 295 KB

(Don’t mind the fray on the inner holes - I messed up the settings on those holes and needed to drill them out.)

0.2in material top surface finish:

IMG_42331920×2560 285 KB

IMG_42341920×2560 282 KB

0.2in material bottom surface finish:

IMG_42351920×2560 353 KB

IMG_42361920×2560 325 KB

The finished pieces put together:

IMG_42311920×2560 322 KB

This does break from what REV recommends, but this is what we found after a lot of test runs. We tried combos from 20% - 100% power, 10mm/s - 200mm/s, and 1-25 passes. In my opinion, the extra passes at speed are allowing less local heat buildup while also ensuring the final composite layer on the bottom is being cut. We had a lot of tests on the 0.1" material make it through the top and core but not cut the bottom weave.

Air assist also made a massive difference. We swapped the provided compressor with the machine shop air line and regulated it to around 50psi. We tried turning it down, but it let melted material build up more. This amount of air blew a lot of strings around the machine which wasn’t great to clean, but it is what it is.

I still don’t think we’re at the perfect settings, so hopefully someone finds them!

","post_number":19,"post_type":1,"posts_count":48,"updated_at":"2025-02-01T21:01:34.793Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":45,"reads":480,"readers_count":479,"score":666.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":477167,"topic_slug":"maxcomposite-experiences-and-tips","display_username":"Drew B.","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://lagunatools.com/cnc/co2-lasers/smartshop-laser-exc","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"SmartShop® Laser | EX-C | CO2 Lasers | Laguna Tools","clicks":20}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":21}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":22795,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"PTC/Onshape Senior Education Solutions Engineer"},"post_url":"/t/maxcomposite-experiences-and-tips/477167/19","custom_user_title":"PTC/Onshape Senior Education Solutions Engineer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":21}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":21,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3499327,"name":"Dale Yocum","username":"Dale","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dale/{size}/1401_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-01T21:52:08.817Z","cooked":"

Nice! We don’t have super high power air assist currently, just what’s built into the machine. I’ll try your multipass method and see how it goes none the less.

","post_number":20,"post_type":1,"posts_count":48,"updated_at":"2025-02-01T21:52:08.817Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":434,"readers_count":433,"score":101.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":477167,"topic_slug":"maxcomposite-experiences-and-tips","display_username":"Dale Yocum","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":4423,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6665 C-Otters/1540 Flaming Chickens"},"post_url":"/t/maxcomposite-experiences-and-tips/477167/20","custom_user_title":"6665 C-Otters/1540 Flaming Chickens","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3499378,"name":"Dale Yocum","username":"Dale","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dale/{size}/1401_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-01T22:18:52.332Z","cooked":"

On our 100w Omtech with stock air assist the single pass was better. The hole on the right, which didn’t make it through was:
100% (100w)
5 passes
30mm/sec

The hole on the left was the same but with seven passes.

Dimensionally it was ever so slightly better but not such that you’d notice.

IMG_01764032×3024 3.44 MB

Not a fan of the white melty bits, probably because of the lack of massive air assist.

Just goes to show every laser is different but this at least gives folks something to start with. Jealous of your results!
